metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23172 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in SoX, where a heap-buffer-overflow occurs infunction startread() in hcom.c file. The vulnerability is exploitable witha crafted hcomn file, that could cause an application to crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23172` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
libsox2 - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
sox - 14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: sox package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '14.4.1-3ubuntu1.1+esm2').
